TEXT: The applicant , OOO Torgovyi Dom “ Politeks ” , is a limited - liability company registered in GPE . It is represented before the ORG by PERSON D. Lyzlov . The respondent Government are represented by Mr P. GPE , ORG at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant is a trading company . It owned a consignment of goods ( imported electric tools ) . Unspecified third persons made groundless claims to the goods . Since there was no evidence to prove these claims in a court , the third persons incited the police to seize the goods under the guise of a sham criminal investigation .

On DATE PERSON was accompanying the goods . He was stopped by a police patrol and taken to a police station . In the course of an interrogation , the police discovered that the applicant company was storing the goods in a warehouse in PERSON . They went there and sealed the warehouse up . The police did not draw up any documents concerning the seizure and the applicant company 's representatives were not allowed to visit the warehouse .

On DATE the police loaded the goods into trucks and removed them from the warehouse . The police did not explain their actions , and the goods have been missing ever since . Later , the goods were spotted on sale in GPE markets .
On DATE the police started a criminal investigation against PERSON on charges of fraud and forgery of documents .

On DATE PERSON filed an administrative complaint on behalf of the applicant company with ORG of GPE . He maintained that the police had unlawfully seized the goods , that the goods had been plundered , and that the criminal charges against him had been unfounded .

On DATE ORG dismissed the complaint . The court found that the police had lawfully seized the goods because they needed to investigate the allegation of a third person , PERSON , who had claimed that the goods belonged to him and not to the applicant company . The police had lawfully formalised the storage of the goods and appointed warehouse staff responsible for the goods ' safety .

The court limited the scope of its review to the administrative aspects of the complaint having referred to LAW which secures to everyone judicial protection against public officials ' acts . The court therefore abstained from looking into the merits of the charges against Mr. Lyzlov and from verifying the safety of the goods .
On appeal , this decision was upheld by ORG on DATE .
Later , the criminal investigation against PERSON was stopped .
A third person , PERSON , applied to the police alleging that goods belonging to his company were unlawfully retained by PERSON in a warehouse of the applicant company .

On DATE the police sealed up the applicant company 's warehouse in PERSON . The police found that PERSON did not work for the applicant company and had no documents confirming his rights on the goods .

On DATE a public prosecutor instituted criminal proceedings against PERSON on charges of fraud and forgery of documents . In the course of the investigation it was established that the goods had been imported in DATE by a third company . The company asked PERSON to customs clear the goods and to store them in its warehouse . However , PERSON breached this agreement . As he considered that the third company owed him money , he hid the goods in a warehouse of the applicant company and requested the third company to pay a ransom for it . The investigating authorities found no evidence that the goods belonged to Mr Lyzlov . Nevertheless , since PERSON actions did not disclose a crime , the proceedings against him were stopped on DATE .
On DATE ORG dismissed PERSON complaint about the police and the institution of the criminal proceedings .
On DATE ORG upheld the judgment on appeal .
